title: Grandma's Best Comfort Food Recipes
description: Master these classic, comfort food recipes and you'll be Grandma's favorite. These comfort food ideas include recipes for pot roast, meatloaf, lasagna, chicken noodle soup, and other favorites.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Grandma's Favorite Comfort Food Recipes By Carl Hanson Carl Hanson Carl Hanson is a Senior Editor at Allrecipes who has been writing about food and wine for nearly 20 years. He enjoys creating content that informs, entertains, and assists busy home cooks get nourishing meals on the table for their families. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on January 15, 2025 Close Credits: acuna_matata Grandma loves you, it's true. And she's already proud of you, we realize. But why push your luck? Master these classic comfort food recipes, and you're golden in Grandma's eyes...forever! These comfort food ideas include top-rated recipes for pot roast, meatloaf, lasagna, chicken noodle soup, apple pie, and so many other old-school favorites. Each comforting recipe rocks that homemade flavor you love from Grandma's kitchen. 01 of 21 Homemade Chicken Noodle Soup KGora It's a fact of life. People you love will catch a honkin' cold. Make them this soup, and it's like donning a superhero's cape. View Recipe Save 02 of 21 Beef Pot Roast Dianne Teresa submitted this comforting classic. "It's best to make it a day ahead," she says. Of course, when something smells this good, 24 hours is an eternity. Reminds me. You know what else Grandma admires? The virtue of patience—and very often the best comfort food rewards it. View Recipe Save 03 of 21 Fried Chicken with Creamy Gravy Allrecipes Magazine This is the real deal, arguably the ultimate comfort food. The chicken is seasoned and fried. The gravy is made from the pan drippings. All that down-home goodness is enough to put a tear of joy in Grandma's eye. View Recipe Save 04 of 21 World's Best Lasagna TheWickedNoodle This five-star recipe made the submitter, John, a minor celebrity. "It takes a little work," he says. "But it is worth it." Agreed, say the 15,000 people who've raved in the reviews. View Recipe Save 05 of 21 Grandma Ople's Apple Pie notyouraveragegranny You knew apple pie would make the list. This is one of our most beloved recipes and a true g'ma classic. View Recipe Save 06 of 21 Modenese Pork Chops SunnyByrd The prep here requires all of 10 minutes. Doing simple things well, though; that's something Grandma can dig. View Recipe Save 07 of 21 Classic Meatloaf *Sherri* There are secrets to getting moist, flavorful meatloaf. Chef John, who is not a grandma but still has very real chops, reveals all in his how-to video. View Recipe Save 08 of 21 Grandma's Green Bean Casserole Allrecipes Magazine If you make this classic casserole from scratch, you will rule the holidays every single year—or any Sunday dinner. View Recipe Save 09 of 21 Chicken Pot Pie IX ReneePaj Also from scratch. (Are you sensing a pattern?) This five-star winner has more than 9,000 reviews. So there's help if you need it and Grandma's not available. View Recipe Save 10 of 21 Fluffy Pancakes Sara Now that's a fat stack. This recipe features a splash of vinegar. Is that what makes 'em fluffy? I bet Grandma knows. This recipe is a good reminder that the best comfort food ideas aren't limited to dinner time. View Recipe Save 11 of 21 Grandma's Chicken Chardon TTV78 Here's a jewel among our treasure chest of comfort food ideas. "Since I made this the first time some months, ago it has been our favorite chicken dish. I've served it to guests a number of times," Charanne says. Certainly, Grandma can echo the value of a crowd-pleasing chicken dish. View Recipe Save 12 of 21 Grandma's Macaroni Salad lutzflcat A simple, straight-forward macaroni salad recipe is a key component of your comfort food classics collection, summer edition. "A sweet macaroni salad just like Grandma used to make," recipe creator Hope writes. "Refrigerate for at least four hours for all of the flavors to blend together." View Recipe Save 13 of 21 Round Steak and Gravy bd.weld "The meat is so tender and moist and the gravy is so flavorful," reviewer COOKINGQUEEN75 says. "Instead of baking it in the oven, I use my pressure cooker. This is wonderful with mashed potatoes, rice, or noodles." View Recipe Save 14 of 21 Grandmother's Buttermilk Cornbread DIZ♥ "If you like the sweeter, more cake-like cornbread served in New England and other areas, you'll adore this recipe," says ASHLEY_S. "Try it for breakfast with butter and maple syrup!" View Recipe Save 15 of 21 Grandma's Lemon Meringue Pie Dianne Here's a classic comfort food in the desert category. "This recipe turned out perfectly. Even I was surprised how much I love the taste," says reviewer MZMUFFIN. "The filling was beautifully creamy. Not too sweet, not too tart. I piled the meringue high on a hot filling. Make sure to nudge the meringue all the way to the edge of the crust to seal the filling." View Recipe Save 16 of 21 Home Style Macaroni and Cheese Alberta Rose "My very first time making homemade mac and cheese, and everyone just loved it! Very creamy," writes reviewer AlinkaPinka, whose efforts would get two thumbs up from Grandma. View Recipe Save 17 of 21 Beef Stew VI lutzflcat "The beef was juicy and tender. I have made beef stew for over 15 years, and it has never come out this good for me before," Dawn Raegene Mendenhall Scott says. "A must-try for anyone who likes hearty meals! I will definitely be making this one again." View Recipe Save 18 of 21 Easy Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies Dianne These perfectly chewy Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies are worthy of a place in Grandma's recipe box. View Recipe Save 19 of 21 Delicious Ham and Potato Soup Lori Enjoying a bowl of this creamy, comforting potato soup is like receiving a hug...from Grandma. View Recipe Save 20 of 21 Mamaw's Chicken and Rice Casserole Melissa Goff "I grew up on this recipe. My grandmother got it from a lady from church at a potluck a long time ago. She passed it down to my mom, and it's always been a family favorite. Quick and easy for school nights, and the leftovers are just as good! You can use less butter on top, of course. But Momma and Mamaw always put the full stick on top," recipe submitter katiefbenham says.
